Lubbock.Rip Griffin Center:
Rip Griffin Center is an indoor arena on the campus of Lubbock Christian University in Lubbock, Texas. The 1,950-seat arena opened in 2000 and is named in honor of former LCU board of trustees member Bobbie Ray "Rip" Griffin (1929-2017), a native of Matador, Texas, who became a prominent Lubbock businessman and philanthropist.
Griffin founded Rip Griffin Truck Stops, which began with a single operation in Lubbock and spread throughout the American West.
